workflow.name: Automate FAQ generation from Stack Overflow to Notion using GPT-4o-mini with Slack alerts
workflow.description:
## üìä Description
This workflow automatically classifies new Stack Overflow questions by topic, generates structured FAQ content using GPT-4o-mini, logs each entry in Google Sheets, saves formatted FAQs in Notion, and notifies your team on Slack ‚Äî ensuring your product and support teams stay aligned with real-world developer discussions. ü§ñüí¨üìö

## ‚öôÔ∏è What This Template Does
- Step 1: Monitors Stack Overflow RSS feeds for new questions related to your selected tags. ‚è±Ô∏è
- Step 2: Filters out irrelevant or incomplete questions before processing. üßπ
- Step 3: Uses OpenAI GPT-4o-mini to classify each question into a topic category (Frontend, Backend, DevOps, etc.). üß†
- Step 4: Generates structured FAQ content including summaries, technical insights, and internal guidance. üìÑ
- Step 5: Saves formatted entries into your Notion knowledge-base database. üìö
- Step 6: Logs all FAQ data into a connected Google Sheet for analytics and tracking. üìä
- Step 7: Sends real-time Slack notifications with quick links to the new FAQ and the original Stack Overflow post. üîî
- Step 8: Provides automatic error detection ‚Äî any failed AI or Notion step triggers an instant Slack alert. üö®

## üí° Key Benefits
‚úÖ Builds a continuously updated, AI-driven knowledge base
 ‚úÖ Reduces repetitive support and documentation work
 ‚úÖ Keeps product and dev teams aware of trending community issues
 ‚úÖ Enhances internal docs with verified Stack Overflow insights
 ‚úÖ Maintains an audit trail via Google Sheets
 ‚úÖ Alerts your team instantly on errors or new FAQs

## üß© Features
- Automatic Stack Overflow RSS monitoring
- Dual-layer OpenAI integration (Topic Classification + FAQ Generation)
- Structured Notion database integration
- Google Sheets logging for analytics
- Slack notifications for new FAQs and error alerts
- Custom tag-based question filtering
- Near real-time updates (every minute)
- Built-in error handling for reliability

## üîê Requirements
- OpenAI API Key (GPT-4o-mini access)
- Notion API credentials with database access
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials
- Slack bot token with chat:write permissions
- Stack Overflow RSS feed URL for your preferred tags

## üë• Target Audience
- SaaS or product teams building internal FAQ and knowledge systems
- Developer relations and documentation teams
- Customer-support teams automating knowledge reuse
- Technical communities curating content from Stack Overflow

## üß≠ Setup Instructions
- Add your OpenAI API credentials in n8n.
- Connect your Notion database and update the page or database ID.
- Connect Google Sheets credentials and select your tracking sheet.
- Connect your Slack account and specify your notification channel.
- Update the RSS Feed URL with your chosen Stack Overflow tags.
- Run the workflow manually once to test connectivity, then enable automation.

workflow.name: Automate FAQ Generation from Stack Overflow to Notion with Slack Alerts and Google Sheet

parameters.content:
## üß© Automate FAQ Generation from Stack Overflow

### How it works
This workflow watches Stack Overflow for new technical questions using RSS, classifies each question topic with OpenAI GPT-4o-mini, and turns it into a structured FAQ entry.  
Each entry is then saved to Notion, logged in Google Sheets, and shared in Slack.  
If any step fails, an alert is sent automatically to your Slack channel.

### Setup steps
1. Connect your **RSS Feed** node and set the Stack Overflow tag query.  
2. Add **OpenAI credentials** (model: gpt-4o-mini).  
3. Connect your **Notion** workspace and choose your FAQ database.  
4. Link your **Google Sheets** account and specify the document + sheet.  
5. Connect **Slack**, select your workspace, and set a target channel ID.  
6. Run once manually to test and confirm that all nodes are working.

## üì° Stack Overflow Feed & Filter  

This section monitors Stack Overflow RSS for new questions and filters out duplicates or irrelevant ones before AI processing.  
Update the RSS tag query and adjust filter rules to match your tech stack.

## üß± Data Preparation & Integration 

 
This section formats the AI output into a clean structure for Notion, Google Sheets, and Slack.  
Merges AI and Notion data so other nodes can access full FAQ details.

## üß† AI Understanding & FAQ Generation  

Uses GPT-4o-mini to first classify each question (Frontend, Backend, DevOps, etc.), then generate a structured FAQ entry including title, summary, insights, and tags.  
Keep prompts concise for best performance.

## üóÇÔ∏è Knowledge Base Logging 

 
Saves each AI-generated FAQ to Notion for internal reference and logs it in Google Sheets for analytics or backup.  
Ensure your Notion DB and Sheet fields match the formatted data.

## üí¨ Team Notifications  


Sends a Slack update when a new FAQ is added.  
Includes summary, category, and links to both Notion and the original Stack Overflow question.

nodes.name: OpenAI - Topic Classifier
nodes.notes: Classifies question topic (Frontend, Backend, DevOps, etc.) before FAQ generation.

nodes.name: Slack - Error Alert
nodes.notes: Sends an error alert message if Topic Classifier, FAQ Generator, or Notion fails.

nodes.name: OpenAI - FAQ Generator
nodes.notes: Uses GPT-4o-mini to analyze Stack Overflow content and generate structured FAQ entries with product-specific guidance

nodes.name: RSS Feed - Stack Overflow Monitor
nodes.notes: Monitors Stack Overflow RSS feed for new questions tagged with specified keywords (python, javascript, devops). Triggers every 30 minutes.

nodes.name: Notion - Create FAQ Entry
nodes.notes: Creates a new page in Notion Knowledge Base database with all FAQ fields populated

nodes.name: Merge Data
nodes.notes: Combines OpenAI output with Notion response for Slack notification

nodes.name: Slack - Notify Team
nodes.notes: Sends formatted notification to #product-faqs channel with FAQ summary, category, and links

parameters.content:
## üö® Error Monitoring  


Catches errors from key nodes (AI, Notion, Sheets) and sends a Slack alert with details for quick debugging.  
Helps ensure the automation runs reliably.

## üîê Credentials & Security  


Use OAuth2 for Slack and Google Sheets, API keys for OpenAI and Notion.  
Avoid using personal credentials in public templates.  
Use environment variables for all IDs or tokens.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
